FuncDef:
The test-session inactive command configures an inactive interval for a test session on the session-reflector.
The undo test-session inactive command cancels the configuration.
By default, the inactive interval of a test session is 900s.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an inactive interval for a test session.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 604800, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A test session is started based on a control session. After the session-reflector is configured, the session-reflector can reply to the session-sender with probes carrying timestamps and serial numbers. Upon receiving response probes, the session-sender calculates the IP performance statistics based on the timestamps and serial numbers and sends the result to the client. The control-client collects statistics and provides them for users.
If a test session stays in the inactive state within the specified inactive interval, the test session is deleted to reduce resource consumption.
